intro: Hedyotis laotica, commonly known as the Laos knotweed, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant features small, clustered white or yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly serrated edge. Hedyotis laotica is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
